intro: Quamoclit digitata, commonly known as the spider plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its long, arching stems that bear clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant also produces bright red berries that are edible for birds and some small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering. Quamoclit digitata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
